section.title: net-edit
section.para: Allows the user to edit the XML configuration of a virtual network, using their preferred editor.
net-edit launches the command (or script) is defined in the users $EDITOR environment variable, passing it a temporary copy of the XML configuration for the virtual network.
When the user exits the editor, net-edit checks if the temporary file was changed.
If it was, then net-edit validates it to ensure it's error free. If no errors are found, net-edit then overwrites the existing saved virtual network configuration using it.

entry.para: The name or UUID of the virtual network whose XML configuration is to be edited.

example.para: Edits the XML configuration for the virtual network named "mynetwork".
Edits the XML configuration for the virtual network having UUID "bfbc4c69-7d6a-cc9a-904c-09910ce179c0".

listitem.para: Starting with a few virtual networks already defined:
listitem.screen: virsh # net-list --all Name State Autostart ----------------------------------------- default active yes examplenetwork active no
listitem.para: We use to view the XML configuration for "examplenetwork":
listitem.screen: virsh # net-dumpxml examplenetwork <network> <name>examplenetwork</name> <uuid>b7005dec-be1a-fe9a-338a-0cb1301dfcfd</uuid> <forward mode='route'/> <bridge name='virbr100' stp='on' delay='0' /> <ip address='10.10.120.1' netmask='255.255.255.0'> </ip> </network>
listitem.para: We want to change one of the values, for example, the Spanning Tree Protocol delay of 0. Let's say want it to be 30 (seconds) instead.
Using net-edit, we launch an editor on the XML fragment. (vi is the editor shown):
The editor window appears, and we make the change directly:
listitem.screen: <network> <name>examplenetwork</name> <uuid>b7005dec-be1a-fe9a-338a-0cb1301dfcfd</uuid> <forward mode='route'/> <bridge name='virbr100' stp='on' delay='30' /> <-- 0 changed to 30 here <ip address='10.10.120.1' netmask='255.255.255.0'> </ip> </network> ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ "/tmp/virsht2UZ6L" 8L, 238C
listitem.para: Then save the (temporary) file and exit the editor. net-edit automatically copies the temporary XML to the saved configuration, if no errors in it were detected.
The next time the "examplenetwork" virtual network is started, it will use the new value.
- Outputs the XML configuration for a virtual network, to stdout.
- Displays a list of the virtual networks libvirt is aware of.
